code: @Manual{,   title = {ggdfe: A Theme for ggplot in Department for Education House Style},   author = {Sam Cooke},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.1.0},   url = {https://dfe-r-community.github.io/ggdfe/}, }

what: A Theme for ggplot in Department for Education House Style
title: A Theme for ggplot in Department for Education House Style
text: package seeks create easy theme add ggplot keep line DfE brand guidelines.

title: A Theme for ggplot in Department for Education House Style
text: two functions work add colour scales: scale_fill_dfe() scale_colour_dfe(). replace usual scale_colour_*() scale_fill_*() functions change colours ggplot. base colours  also palettes, passed ‘palettes’ argument. selecting suitable subset colours , depending need discrete, continuous diverging palette. main - Blue red turquoise (discrete, 3 colours) warm - Red purple (continuous) cool - Blue lime (continuous) full - colours brand (discrete, 7 colours) likert - red blue, grey midpoint (diverging) likert2 - green purple, white midpoint (diverging) likert3 - red blue, white midpoint (diverging) heat - white red (continuous) heat2 - white pink (continuous) cold - white blue (continuous) cold2 - white turqouise (continuous)  Exaples usage :
code: ggplot2::ggplot(data = iris)+   ggplot2::aes(x=Sepal.Length, colour = Species)+   ggplot2::geom_density(linewidth = 1.5)+   scale_colour_dfe(palette = "main")+   ggplot2::theme_minimal()

title: Add colour and fill scales to ggplot with DfE theme — scale_colour_dfe
text: Add colour fill scales ggplot DfE theme

title: Add colour and fill scales to ggplot with DfE theme — scale_colour_dfe
code: scale_colour_dfe(palette = "main", discrete = TRUE, reverse = FALSE, ...)  scale_fill_dfe(palette = "main", discrete = TRUE, reverse = FALSE, ...)

title: Add colour and fill scales to ggplot with DfE theme — scale_colour_dfe
text: palette colour palette use discrete scale discrete (defaults TRUE) reverse Reverse order scale (defaults FALSE) ... arguments passed onto discrete_scale() scale_fill_gradientn()

title: Add colour and fill scales to ggplot with DfE theme — scale_colour_dfe
text: palettes current form main - Blue red turquoise (discrete, 3 colours) warm - Red purple (continuous) cool - Blue lime (continuous) full - colours brand (discrete, 7 colours) likert - red blue, grey midpoint (diverging) likert2 - green purple, white midpoint (diverging) likert3 -  red blue, white midpoint (diverging) heat - white red (continuous) heat2 - white pink (continuous) cold - white blue (continuous) cold2 - white turqouise (continuous)

title: Add colour and fill scales to ggplot with DfE theme — scale_colour_dfe
text: scale_fill_dfe(): Add fill scale ggplot DfE theme

title: Add colour and fill scales to ggplot with DfE theme — scale_colour_dfe
code: library(ggplot2)   ggplot(iris, aes(x = Sepal.Width, y = Sepal.Length, colour = Species)) +   geom_point() +   scale_colour_dfe()   ggplot(iris, aes(x = Petal.Length, y = Sepal.Length,colour = Sepal.Width)) +   geom_point(size = 3, alpha = 3/4) +   scale_colour_dfe(palette = "heat", discrete = FALSE)   ggplot(iris, aes(Species, Sepal.Length, fill = Species)) +   geom_col() +   scale_fill_dfe()   ggplot(faithfuld, aes(waiting, eruptions, fill = density)) +   geom_tile() +   scale_fill_dfe(discrete = FALSE, palette = "heat")

title: DfE Plot Themes — themes
code: theme_nimbus(   base_size = 11,   base_family = "",   base_line_size = base_size/22,   base_rect_size = base_size/22,   all_gridlines = FALSE )

title: DfE Plot Themes — themes
text: base_size, base_family, base_line_size, base_rect_size See ggplot2::theme_grey() details all_gridlines Set TRUE show panel gridlines - default, vertical gridlines shown.

title: DfE Plot Themes — themes
code: library(ggplot2)  p1 <- ggplot(diamonds, aes(carat, price)) + geom_point() p2 <- p1 + facet_wrap(~cut)  p1 + theme_nimbus() + ggtitle("theme_nimbus()")  p2 + theme_nimbus() + ggtitle("theme_nimbus()")
